Posts.Content: May 12, 2008 08:52PM candy2007 wrote: Hi Ferrajina, Your bio is so similar to mine.  I was 38 when I found the lump.  Diagnosed with Invasive Ductal Carcinoma in June 2007.  Started Chemo. in July, 4 Adriamycian and Cytoxan treatments and 4 Taxol and started Herceptin.  Have to take Herceptin until Sept. 2008.  Finished chemo. treatment on Halloween 2007.  Had bilateral mastectomy with Sentinal Node Biopsy.  Had tissue expanders put in and then had the exchange surgery to silicone implants in March 2008.  Taking Tamoxifen also.  I am sched. to have the Nipple reconstruction on 5/23/08.  I am a little nervous about this part.  I don't really know what to expect.  My ps is going to take the skin from the sides of my breast area, under my arm area.  Kind of hard to explain, but I hope you get where I am talking about.    Are you having problems with hot flashes?  I am mine are terrible.  I don't sleep and try to stay in the air conditioning.  The winter time was great for me.  I would have a flash and just go outside in the cold.  It felt wonderful.  I have tried 3 kinds of med. for the hot flashes and so far nothing has helped.  If you are on any med. for this please let me know what kind you are taking if it is helping you.  I don't know what I am going to do this summer.  We have a farm and you can't stay inside and raise veggies and get up hay.  Oh well, you do what you have to do.  I hope that you are feeling better.  Any info. that you could give me about the recovery after the nipple recon. would be greatly appreciated. Thanks and my prayers are with you, Candy
Posts.Title: Nipple - Areolar Reconstruction ferrajina candy2007

Posts.Content: May 14, 2008 04:35PM candy2007 wrote: Hi Leener, I am sorry to hear that you are having problems with fluid.  Those drains are a pain.  I had a seroma near my arm pit and had it drained twice.  It needs to be done one more time I think.  I don't have tremors, but if you do the Neurontin should help them.  My dad has tremors and he takes that to help with his.  If it doesn't be sure to tell your dr.  There are several different kinds of meds. that they have out for tremors.  How does Vit. E help?  Does the clonodine seem to be helping?  I am still getting Herceptin.  Do you have to take that? I live in North Carolina, not too far from FL, so I know what you mean.  The summers here can be pretty hot.  When my hot flashes started they were not that bad, but now they are terrible and I have one at least every hour that last for about 15 minutes each.  I kind of miss not having any hair, at least it was cooler then.  But, I do like that my hair is starting to come back.  I have a good two inches now and can style it, somewhat.  Everybody says that it looks good, but I still don't like it.  Probably won't until it gets a lot longer.  I went from really long hair (3 1/2 feet of it) to bald.  BIG Difference.  Thanks for the info. I will check with my dr. about the clonodine. Candy

Posts.Content: candy2007 wrote: Hello, I just had nipple reconstruction yesterday.  I was wanting to know if anyone knows how long it will take for the graft area to stop hurting.  It is not very bad, but real uncomfortable.  Feels like I have been doing sit ups non-stop.  Had graft taken off of my stomach.  My chest is not bothering me at all, probably because I didn't have any feeling there before surgery.   Any insite into what I can expect when I get bandages off this coming Thursday would be greatly appreciated.
